title: Fuel Pump - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
A fire, causing personal injury and damage to property could result from spilled fuel or fuel not handled or stored correctly.
Disconnect the fuel pump electrical connector.
Release the hose clip securing the hose to the fuel pipe.
Note the orientation of the baffle housing for installation.
It is not necessary to disconnect the baffle housing hose from the fuel pressure regulator unless it is to be removed at the same time as the fuel pump.
Release the hose clamp securing the baffle housing to the fuel pump.
Reposition the hose clamp and carefully slide the baffle housing off the fuel pump body.
Remove the baffle housing hose clamp over the inlet filter.
Note that there is a ground cable secured by the fuel pump clamp fixing for installation.
Release the fixing, detach the ground cable and remove the fuel pump strap.

Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Observe the warning advice given in the General Information section on the safe handling of fuel and fuel containers.
A fire, causing personal injury and damage to property could result from spilled fuel or fuel not handled or stored correctly.
Perform the following operations:
Fuel Pump Assembly - Removal
Disconnect the fuel pump electrical connector.
Release the hose clip securing the hose to the fuel pipe.
Hose clip
Electrical connector
Note the orientation of the baffle housing for installation.
It is not necessary to disconnect the baffle housing hose from the fuel pressure regulator unless it is to be removed at the same time as the fuel pump.
Release the hose clamp securing the baffle housing to the fuel pump.
Reposition the hose clamp and carefully slide the baffle housing off the fuel pump body.
Remove the baffle housing hose clamp over the inlet filter.
Note that there is a ground cable secured by the fuel pump clamp fixing for installation.
Release the fixing, detach the ground cable and remove the fuel pump strap.
Hose clamp
Baffle housing
Fixing
Ground cable
Strap
Remove the fuel pump.
